qas.question: What are the most popular sports in Eritrea?
What world record is held by Eritrean athlete Zersenay Tadese?
What is the name of the multi-stage international cycling event held throughout Eritrea?
Who became the first black African riders to compete in the Tour de France?

answers.text: Teklehaimanot and fellow Eritrean Merhawi Kudus

qas.question: Who became the first Eritrean to ride the Vuelta a Espana in 2012?
Who won the last Tour of Eritrea?
Who is one of the members of the Eritrea national cycling team?
What football team does Didier Drogba play for?
What was Merhawi Kudus wearing at the end of the 2015 Tour de France?
Who won the 2012 Vuelta a Espana?

context: <a0_0>Football and cycling<a0_0/> are the most popular sports in Eritrea. In recent years, Eritrean athletes have also seen increasing success in the international arena. <b5_0>Zersenay Tadese<b5_0/>, an Eritrean athlete, currently holds the world record in <a1_0>half marathon distance running<a1_0/>. The <a2_0>Tour of Eritrea<a2_0/>, a multi-stage international cycling event, is held annually throughout the country. The Eritrea national cycling team has experienced a lot of success, winning the continental cycling championship several years in a row. Six Eritrean riders have been signed to international cycling teams, including Natnael Berhane and <a4_0>Daniel Teklehaimanot<a4_0/>. Berhane was named African Sportsman of the Year in 2013, ahead of footballers Yaya Touré and <b6_0>Didier Drogba<b6_0/>, while Teklehaimanot became the first Eritrean to ride the Vuelta a España in 2012. In 2015 Teklehaimanot won the King of the Mountains classification in the Critérium du Dauphine. <a3_0>Teklehaimanot and fellow Eritrean <b9_0>Merhawi Kudus<b9_0/><a3_0/> became the first black African riders to compete in the Tour de France when they were selected by the <b7_0>MTN–Qhubeka<b7_0/> team for the 2015 edition of the race, where, on 9 July, Teklehaimanot became the first African rider to wear the <b8_0>polkadot jersey<b8_0/>.
